hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Compression Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: When a significant negative news catalyst (e.g., large liquidation event, macro scare) causes a sharp 1-hour price drop (>3%) on elevated volume (>1.5x 20-day avg), the subsequent 4-hour period will exhibit mean-reverting behavior as short-term panic subsides, providing a long entry edge.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Sharp, news-driven sell-offs in neutral/bull regimes often overextend due to emotional trading and forced liquidations. A period of compression after the initial spike suggests exhaustion. The edge comes from fading the retail panic while the underlying macro or structural trend remains intact.
entry_conditions: BTC 1-hour candle closes down >3% on volume >1.5x 20-day average
The drop is accompanied by identifiable negative news headline (macro catalyst, large liquidation report)
Next 1-hour candle trades within 0.5% of previous close (volatility compression)

exit_conditions.time_exit: 4 hours after entry if neither TP nor SL hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 55% of such setups continue trending downward beyond the -1.5% stop loss within the 4-hour window, indicating the news catalyst has initiated a genuine regime change rather than a temporary dislocation.
